pr_title: DDF-UI-135 filter blank attributes from CSV export result

timeline.bodyText:
columnOrder is defined in a constant here

  
    
      ddf/catalog/transformer/catalog-transformer-csv-queryresponse/src/main/java/ddf/catalog/transformer/csv/CsvQueryResponseTransformer.java
    
    
         Line 46
      in
      b054ac2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public static final String COLUMN_ORDER_KEY = "columnOrder";
timeline.author: bdeining

timeline.bodyText: Something to consider is using the columnOrder constant here as well in case the constant value ever changed (however maybe unlikely). I wouldn't hold up the PR for it. Would the test just fail in that case?
timeline.author: shaundmorris

replies.bodyText: @shaundmorris yes, good catch. the other prs have already been merged, otherwise i'd make the change.
replies.author: cassandrabailey293

timeline.message: DDF-UI-135 pass attributes to the csv transformer
DDF-UI-135 only filter if columnOrder is provided
DDF-UI-135 use List instead of ArrayList
DDF-UI-135 use CollectionUtils and import List
DDF-UI-135 use defined constant for columnOrder
